Create a PWFSLSmoke ws_monitor object from a Raster\* object

raster_toMonitor.Rd

Time series associated with multiple grid cells are converted into a PWFSLSmoke ws_monitor. The monitorID associated with each location is generated with:

  MazamaLocationUtils::location_createID(x, y)

raster_toMonitor(
  raster,
  longitude = NULL,
  latitude = NULL,
  radius = 5,
  count = NULL,
  rasterName = NULL,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

raster

A Raster* object.
longitude

Target longitude from which the radius will be calculated.
latitude

Target latitude from which the radius will be calculated.
radius

Distance (km) of radius from target location.
count

Number of grid cells within radius to return.
rasterName

Optional string prepended to monitorIDs.
verbose

Logical to display messages.

Value

A PWFSLSmoke ws_monitor object representing a single monitor.

Examples

# \donttest{
library(AirFireModeling)
setModelDataDir('~/Data/BlueSky')

# Load model data
rasterList <- raster_load(
  modelName = c("PNW-1.33km", "PNW-4km"),
  modelRun = c(2020091300),
  xlim = c(-125, -115),
  ylim = c(42, 50)
)

#> Loading PNW-1.33km_2020091300 ...
#> Loading PNW-4km_2020091300 ...

# MazamaSpatialUtils are needed to determine timezone and state
library(MazamaSpatialUtils)
PWFSLSmoke::initializeMazamaSpatialUtils()

model_Portland <- raster_toMonitor(
  rasterList,
  longitude = -122.68,
  latitude = 45.52,
  radius = 5
)

#> Converting PNW-1.33km_2020091300 to ws_monitor ...
#> Converting PNW-4km_2020091300 to ws_monitor ...

PWFSLSmoke::monitor_timeseriesPlot(
  model_Portland[[1]],
  type = 'l', col = 'salmon'
)

PWFSLSmoke::monitor_timeseriesPlot(
  model_Portland[[2]],
  type = 'l', col = 'dodgerblue', add = TRUE
)


legend(
  x = "topright",
  legend = names(model_Portland),
  lwd = c(1, 1),
  col= c("salmon", "dodgerblue")
)

# }
